Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Shapely \Shape"ly\, a. [Compar. {Shapelier}; superl. {Shapeliest}.] 1. Well-formed; having a regular shape; comely; symmetrical. --T. Warton. [1913 Webster]
Waste sandy valleys, once perplexed with thorn, The spiry fir and shapely box adorn. --Pope. [1913 Webster]
Where the shapely column stood. --Couper. [1913 Webster]
2. Fit; suitable. [Obs.] [1913 Webster]
Shaply for to be an alderman. --Chaucer. [1913 Webster]
shapely adj : having a well-proportioned and pleasing shape; "a slim waist and shapely legs" [ant: {unshapely}] [also: {shapeliest}, {shapelier}]
